intro: Illecebrum pubescens, commonly known as the hairy spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Illecebrum pubescens is also noted for its ability to spread via stolons, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
